title: How to Repair a Broken Lipstick

steps.title: Prepare a clean work surface.
steps.content: Prepare a clean work surface. Lay out paper towels on the work surface. Wear thin, disposable gloves to keep your hands clean and prevent anything sticking to the lipstick.

steps.title: Swivel up the lipstick as far as possible.
steps.content: Swivel up the lipstick as far as possible. Expose the broken end that is still set in the base.

steps.title: Remove the broken piece.
steps.content: Remove the broken piece. If it hasn't already fallen off, pick it up with a gloved hand.

steps.title: Melt the broken ends of the lipstick.
steps.content: Melt the broken ends of the lipstick. [1] X Expert Source Luca Buzas Makeup Artist & Wardrobe Stylist Expert Interview. 21 June 2019. Using a match or lighter, carefully run the flame underneath the broken part of the lipstick to soften it. Slightly melt the end of the lipstick that's still in the tube. Take care not to burn the lipstick or melt the case. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Connect the broken piece to the base.
steps.content: Connect the broken piece to the base. Press the broken piece gently to the base of the lipstick. [3] X Expert Source Luca Buzas Makeup Artist & Wardrobe Stylist Expert Interview. 21 June 2019.

steps.title: Seal the edges.
steps.content: Seal the edges. Use a toothpick or the end of a clean match to gently move the sides of the lipstick together and seal the stick as one piece.

steps.title: Put the lipstick in the fridge for about 30 minutes.
steps.content: Put the lipstick in the fridge for about 30 minutes. Let it cool until it's completely solid. If it still feels soft, leave it in for a while longer so it doesn't break again. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Prepare your work surface.
steps.content: Prepare your work surface. Put paper towels on your work surface to catch any drips.

steps.title: Remove the lipstick.
steps.content: Remove the lipstick. When it was melted, the lipstick probably pooled on the side and bottom of the tube, then hardened. Scoop it out of the tube with a small knife or paper clip. Be sure to get as much of it out as possible, so you don't waste any.

steps.title: Melt it to remove lumps.
steps.content: Melt it to remove lumps. To make your new lipstick perfectly smooth, put it in a metal spoon and hold it over a candle flame until it melts.

steps.title: Pour it into your new container.
steps.content: Pour it into your new container. Pour the liquid lipstick into a small, clean container. [5] X Expert Source Luca Buzas Makeup Artist & Wardrobe Stylist Expert Interview. 21 June 2019. Lip balm jars are a good size and have lids that will close tightly, keeping your lipstick clean and contained. Empty pill containers will also work, but probably wonâ€™t be secure enough to toss in your purse.

steps.title: Put it in the fridge for half an hour.
steps.content: Put it in the fridge for half an hour. It will cool and turn solid. Once hardened, your lipstick is ready to wear. Apply with a lip brush to keep your fingers clean and enjoy!
